2. Main Headline (.title-h2.white)

Function: Primary value proposition with maximum visual impact

Typography:

  • Font: Satoshi, sans-serif (Custom font for H1/H2)
  • Weight: 400 (Regular)
  • Line Height: 1.3
  • Letter Spacing: -3px (significant tightening)
  • Color: var(--neutral--100) / #ffffff
  • Display: flex (for layout flexibility)

Animation System

A comprehensive animation framework featuring keyframe-based animations, hover effects, and progressive disclosure patterns. Built for performance and accessibility with consistent timing and easing functions.

Live Animation Examples

Progressive Disclosure

Complete UI Library

Onboarding sequences

Pattern: Staggered 0.2s delays

Float In Effect

Use Case: Hero transitions

Sequential Steps

Step 1
Step 2
Step 3
Step 4

Pattern: 20% timing offsets

Scale Transform

Mobile
Desktop

Use Case: Hover effects

Choreographed Elements

Sync Content
IMG

Pattern: Synchronized movement

Timing Functions

ease-in-out - Standard
ease - Quick
linear - Consistent

Best Practice: Use ease-in-out

Animation Specifications

Timing Functions

ease-in-out - Standard transitions
ease - Quick interactions
linear - Consistent progress

Duration Standards

0.2s - Quick hover effects
0.3s - Standard transitions
3-8s - Ambient animations

Transform Properties

translateY(10%) - Vertical movement
scale(0.9-1.1) - Size changes
opacity(0-1) - Fade effects

Keyframe Definitions

Progressive Disclosure Pattern

@keyframes checkBounce {
  0% { transform: scale(0); }
  30% { transform: scale(1.1); }
  40% { transform: scale(1); }
  70% { transform: scale(1); }
  100% { transform: scale(0); }
}

@keyframes textSlide {
  0% { opacity: 0; transform: translateX(20px); }
  40% { opacity: 1; transform: translateX(0); }
  70% { opacity: 1; transform: translateX(0); }
  100% { opacity: 0; transform: translateX(20px); }
}

Usage: Apply to elements with staggered delays (0.2s, 0.4s) for natural flow

Float In Effect

@keyframes floatIn {
  0% { transform: translate3d(0, 10%, 0); opacity: 0; }
  50% { transform: translate3d(0, 0%, 0); opacity: 1; }
  100% { transform: translate3d(0, 10%, 0); opacity: 0; }
}

/* Usage */
.hero-image {
  animation: floatIn 5s ease-in-out infinite;
}

Best Practice: Use translate3d for hardware acceleration and smoother performance

Sequential Step Animation

@keyframes step1 {
  0% { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(10px); }
  20% { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }
  80% { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }
  100% { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(-10px); }
}

@keyframes step2 {
  0% { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(10px); }
  20% { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(10px); }
  40% { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }
  80% { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }
  100% { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(-10px); }
}

/* Continue pattern for step3, step4... */

Pattern: Each step starts 20% later in the timeline, creating cascading effect

Scale Transform Animation

@keyframes scaleContainer {
  0% { opacity: 0; transform: scale(0.9); }
  50% { opacity: 1; transform: scale(1); }
  100% { opacity: 0; transform: scale(0.9); }
}

/* Hover Effect Variation */
.hover-scale {
  transition: transform 0.3s ease;
}

.hover-scale:hover {
  transform: scale(1.05);
}

Use Case: Card interactions, button hover states, and responsive breakpoint transitions

Implementation Guide

HTML Structure

<lt;!-- Progressive Disclosure Example -->
<div class="flex align-top mg-bottom-8px">
  <img src="images/LightRedCircleDarkCheck.svg" 
       class="mg-right-24px animation-check-bounce" 
       style="animation-delay: 0.2s;">
  <div class="animation-text-slide" style="animation-delay: 0.4s;">
    <h3>Content reveals after check animation</h3>
  </div>
</div>

CSS Integration

/* Include in your CSS file */
@keyframes checkBounce { /* ... */ }
@keyframes textSlide { /* ... */ }
@keyframes floatIn { /* ... */ }

/* Apply to elements */
.animation-check-bounce { 
  animation: checkBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite; 
  animation-delay: 0.2s; 
}

.animation-text-slide { 
  animation: textSlide 3s ease-in-out infinite; 
  animation-delay: 0.4s; 
}

Performance Optimization

  • Use translate3d instead of translate for hardware acceleration
  • Prefer transform and opacity for smooth animations
  • Add will-change: transform for complex animations
  • Use animation-fill-mode: both to maintain start/end states

Accessibility Considerations

  • Respect prefers-reduced-motion user preference
  • Provide static fallbacks for essential content
  • Avoid rapid flashing or strobing effects
  • Keep animation duration under 5 seconds for ambient effects

Usage Patterns & Best Practices

Progressive Disclosure
Notice → Headline → Benefits → CTAs
1. Notice badge grabs attention
2. Headline states value prop
3. Benefits provide proof
4. CTAs drive action
Responsive Strategy
Mobile-first with adaptive layouts
• Separate mobile/desktop containers
• Scaled content for different screens
• Optimized image loading
• Touch-friendly button sizes
Animation Guidelines
Smooth, purposeful transitions
• 10% Y-translate for entry
• Opacity fade for smoothness
• Staggered timing for flow
• data-w-id triggers

Integration Card Components

White card integration style pattern used for showcasing service integrations, partnerships, and third-party connections. Features consistent typography, badge system, and hover effects optimized for integration listings and marketing content.

Component Structure

Base Integration Card

<lt;a href="#" class="card integrations-slider-link-card w-inline-block">
  <img src="images/service-logo.png" loading="eager" alt="Service Name" class="max-w-70px mg-bottom-24px">
  <h3 class="card-link-title---hover-primary">Service Name</h3>
  <p class="color-neutral-600">Service description and benefits</p>
  <div class="badge-secondary light integrations-slider-card-badge">Popular</div>
</a>

CSS Styles

Base Card Styles

.card.integrations-slider-link-card {
  z-index: 1;
  border: 1px solid var(--neutral--300);
  box-shadow: 0 2px 6px 0 var(--general--shadow-01);
  padding: 24px 40px 48px;
  text-decoration: none;
  transition: none;
  display: block;
  position: relative;
}

.card-link-title---hover-primary {
  color: #143197;
  font-family: Manrope, sans-serif;
  font-weight: 500;
}

.badge-secondary.light.integrations-slider-card-badge {
  z-index: 1;
  padding: 12px 18px;
  font-family: Manrope, sans-serif;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 400;
  position: absolute;
  top: 24px;
  right: 24px;
}

Responsive Styles

/* Tablet (768px and below) */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  .card.integrations-slider-link-card {
    padding-left: 32px;
    padding-right: 32px;
  }
}

/* Mobile (479px and below) */
@media (max-width: 479px) {
  .card.integrations-slider-link-card {
    padding-left: 24px;
    padding-right: 24px;
  }
}

Usage Guidelines

✅ Best Practices

  • Use clear, descriptive service names
  • Keep descriptions concise (1-2 lines)
  • Choose meaningful badge categories
  • Ensure logo images are optimized (70px max)
  • Use consistent aspect ratios for logos
  • Include alt text for accessibility
  • Group related integrations together

❌ Avoid

  • Long descriptions that break layout
  • Inconsistent badge terminology
  • Low-quality or pixelated logos
  • Missing or generic alt text
  • Overuse of colorful badges
  • Breaking the card's visual hierarchy
  • Inconsistent spacing between elements

/* Using CSS Variables */
.custom-button {
  background: var(--krushr-primary);
  color: var(--neutral--100);
  border: 2px solid var(--krushr-primary);
}

.task-card {
  background: var(--neutral--200);
  border: 1px solid var(--neutral--300);
  color: var(--neutral--800);
}

.success-message {
  background: var(--krushr-success);
  color: var(--neutral--100);
}

Pre-built classes for common use cases

Accessibility Guidelines

Ensuring proper contrast and readability
  • All color combinations meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards
  • Minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text
  • Minimum contrast ratio of 3:1 for large text
  • Never rely solely on color to convey information
  • Provide text alternatives for color-coded elements
  • Test with color-blind simulation tools

Navigation Components

Purpose: Comprehensive navigation system with multi-level dropdowns, interactive states, and responsive design. Features header wrapper, menu structures, dropdown content, and mobile-optimized navigation patterns.

Navigation System Breakdown

Core Structure

Essential navigation components
.header-wrapper - Main navigation container with full-width responsive layout
.container.is-nav - Navigation content wrapper with max-width constraints
.menu - Primary navigation menu container
.menu_dp-wrap - Dropdown wrapper for menu items

Interactive Elements

User interaction components
.menu_dp-link - Individual dropdown menu items
.menu_link-padding - Padding wrapper for menu links
.dropdown-content-wrapper - Dropdown content containers
.drop-link-wrapper - Individual dropdown link items

          <div class="text-200 medium color-neutral-800"><strong>Warning</strong></div>
          <div class="text-200 medium">Your trial expires in 3 days</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <!-- Error Notification -->
    <div class="notification error border-radius-8px padding-16px">
      <div class="flex align-top">
        <div class="notification-icon error mg-right-16px-2">×</div>
        <div>
          <div class="text-200 medium color-neutral-800"><strong>Error</strong></div>
          <div class="text-200 medium">Failed to save changes. Please try again.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <a href="#" class="btn-secondary w-button">View All Notifications<span class="line-rounded-icon link-icon-right"></span></a>
</div>

Integration Best Practices

Design System Rules

  • Typography Pairing: Always use Satoshi for H1/H2, Manrope for all other text
  • Color Consistency: Stick to the defined color palette
  • Spacing System: Use 8px increments (8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48px)
  • Animation Timing: Use 0.2s for micro-interactions, 0.3s for transitions
  • Border Radius: 8px for buttons, 12px for cards, 16px for containers

Component Hierarchy

  • Level 1: Page layouts and major sections
  • Level 2: Cards, panels, and content containers
  • Level 3: Buttons, form elements, and interactive components
  • Level 4: Icons, badges, and micro-elements
  • Level 5: Typography and spacing utilities

CSS Variables Reference

Colors
/* Brand Colors */
--krushr-primary: #143197;
--krushr-secondary: #EB5857;
--krushr-success: #1FBB65;
--krushr-warning: #FFB366;
--krushr-info: #57C7EB;

/* Neutral Colors */
--neutral-100: #ffffff;
--neutral-200: #f8fafc;
--neutral-600: #64748b;
--neutral-800: #1e293b;
Typography & Spacing
/* Typography */
--font-heading: 'Manrope', sans-serif;
--font-display: 'Satoshi', sans-serif;
--font-body: 'Manrope', sans-serif;

/* Spacing Scale */
--space-xs: 8px;
--space-sm: 16px;
--space-md: 24px;
--space-lg: 32px;
--space-xl: 40px;
--space-2xl: 48px;

Icon System

Purpose: Comprehensive icon system using Line Rounded Icons font family with consistent styling patterns. Features contextual icons, directional arrows, and semantic classes for enhanced UX.

Icon Families

Line Rounded Icons

Primary icon family with consistent stroke width and rounded corners

dropdown-arrow

link-icon-right

link-icon-left

success-message-check

dropdown-arrow-white

dropdown-arrow-sidebar

CSS Font Declaration
@font-face { font-family: Line Rounded Icons; src: url('../fonts/line-rounded-icons.woff2') format("woff2"), url('../fonts/line-rounded-icons.woff') format("woff"), url('../fonts/line-rounded-icons.ttf') format("truetype"); font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-display: swap; }
Base CSS Class
.line-rounded-icon { font-family: Line Rounded Icons, sans-serif; }

Contextual Icon Patterns

Navigation & Directional

Dropdown Menu
<lt;div class="line-rounded-icon dropdown-arrow"></div>
Call to Action
<lt;span class="line-rounded-icon link-icon-right"></span>
Back Button
<lt;span class="line-rounded-icon link-icon-left"></span>
Success Message
<lt;div class="line-rounded-icon success-message-check"></div>

Button Integration Patterns

Button + Icon HTML
<lt;button class="btn-primary"> Primary Action <span class="line-rounded-icon link-icon-right"></span> </button> <button class="btn-secondary"> <span class="line-rounded-icon link-icon-left"></span> Secondary Action </button>

Icon Sizing & Spacing

Size Variations

Small (16px)

Default (22px)

Large (32px)

Hero (80px)

Spacing Classes
/* Right margin for left-positioned icons */ .line-rounded-icon.link-icon-left { margin-right: 6px; } /* Left margin for right-positioned icons */ .line-rounded-icon.link-icon-right { margin-left: 6px; } /* Custom spacing */ .line-rounded-icon.mg-right-4px { margin-right: 4px; } /* Success message spacing */ .line-rounded-icon.success-message-check { margin-bottom: 6px; } .line-rounded-icon.success-message-check---left { margin-right: 8px; margin-bottom: 0; }

CSS Customizations

Color Variations
/* Primary brand color */ .line-rounded-icon.primary { color: #143197; } /* Success state */ .line-rounded-icon.success { color: #10b981; } /* Warning state */ .line-rounded-icon.warning { color: #f59e0b; } /* Error state */ .line-rounded-icon.error { color: #ef4444; }
Custom Spacing
/* Custom margin classes */ .line-rounded-icon.mg-right-4px { margin-right: 4px; } .line-rounded-icon.mg-left-8px { margin-left: 8px; } .line-rounded-icon.mg-bottom-6px { margin-bottom: 6px; }
Hover States
/* Hover interaction for white arrows */ .line-rounded-icon.dropdown-arrow-white:hover { color: #e2e8f0; transition: color 0.2s ease; } /* Interactive icon scaling */ .line-rounded-icon.interactive:hover { transform: scale(1.1); transition: transform 0.2s ease; }

Accessibility Guidelines

Semantic HTML

Icons should be decorative only. Use proper HTML semantics for functionality.

<lt;button aria-label="Close menu"> <span class="line-rounded-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button>
Color Contrast

Ensure sufficient contrast ratios (4.5:1 minimum) for icon colors.

Good contrast: #10b981 on white
Interactive Elements

Ensure interactive icons have proper focus states and touch targets.

.line-rounded-icon:focus { outline: 2px solid #143197; outline-offset: 2px; }

Development Notes: Icons are font-based and scale automatically with font-size. Use consistent spacing classes for alignment. Always test icon visibility across different backgrounds.

Key CSS Classes: line-rounded-icon, dropdown-arrow, link-icon-right, success-message-check

Responsive Breakpoints Reference

Desktop
992px and up
Full grid layouts, horizontal navigation
Tablet
768px - 991px
Reduced columns, larger touch targets
Mobile
767px and below
Single column, stacked layout
Large Desktop
1200px and up
Maximum container width, optimal spacing

._1-col-tablet /* 1 column on tablet and mobile */
._2-col-tablet /* 2 columns on tablet, 1 on mobile */
._2-col-mbp /* 2 columns on mobile portrait */

.header-btn-hidden-on-mb /* Hide on mobile */

Typography System

Complete typography hierarchy with Satoshi (H1/H2 only) and Manrope fonts. Each class includes live examples, CSS specifications, and usage guidelines.

Display Headings

Landing Page Hero
Class: .display-2
Font: Satoshi, sans-serif (H1/H2 only)
Size: 56px / Weight: 700
Use Case: Primary hero headlines
<lt;div class="display-2">Landing Page Hero</div>
Section Headlines
Class: .display-3
Font: Satoshi, sans-serif (H1/H2 only)
Size: 48px / Weight: 600
Use Case: Major section headers
<lt;h2 class="display-3">Section Headlines</h2>

Primary Page Title

Class: .title-h2
Font: Satoshi, sans-serif (H1/H2 only)
Size: 40px / Weight: 400
Use Case: Page titles, hero subtitles
<lt;h1 class="title-h2">Primary Page Title</h1>

Content Headings

Article Headlines
Class: .heading-h1-size
Font: Manrope, sans-serif
Size: 32px / Weight: 600
Use Case: Article titles, content headers
<lt;h1 class="heading-h1-size">Article Headlines</h1>

Component Headers

Class: .heading-h4-size
Font: Manrope, sans-serif
Size: 20px / Weight: 600
Use Case: Card titles, feature headers
<lt;h3 class="heading-h4-size">Component Headers</h3>
Subsection Title
Class: .title-h5
Font: Manrope, sans-serif
Size: 18px / Weight: 700
Use Case: Small headings, labels
<lt;h5 class="title-h5">Subsection Title</h5>

Body Text & Content

This is the standard paragraph text used throughout the design system. It provides excellent readability and visual hierarchy for main content areas.

Class: .paragraph-18px
Font: Manrope, sans-serif
Size: 18px / Weight: 400
Use Case: Main content, descriptions
<lt;p class="paragraph-18px">Standard content paragraph</p>
Regular text content
Medium weight content
Bold emphasis text
Classes: .text-200
Variants: .medium, .bold
Size: 16px
Use Case: Secondary content, labels
<lt;div class="text-200">Regular text</div>
<div class="text-200 medium">Medium weight</div>
<div class="text-200 bold">Bold emphasis</div>
Small headings and labels
Class: .text-300
Font: Manrope, sans-serif
Size: 14px / Weight: 700
Use Case: Small headings, navigation
<lt;div class="text-300 bold">Small headings</div>

Special Elements

Supporting subtitle text
Class: .subtitle
Font: Manrope, sans-serif
Size: 20px / Weight: 500
Use Case: Supporting headlines
<lt;div class="subtitle">Supporting subtitle text</div>
$49/mo
Class: .display-5
Font: Manrope, sans-serif
Size: 36px / Weight: 700
Use Case: Pricing, large numbers
<lt;div class="display-5">$49/mo</div>

Typography Guidelines

Font Stack

  • Satoshi: H1 and H2 headings only
  • Manrope: Content, headings, body text
  • Manrope: All text except H1/H2 headings

Best Practices

  • Use semantic HTML elements (h1, h2, p)
  • Maintain consistent vertical rhythm
  • Ensure proper contrast ratios (4.5:1 minimum)
  • Test on multiple screen sizes

Responsive Behavior

How layouts adapt across different screen sizes

Responsive Modifiers:
_1-col-tablet
_2-col-mbl
_2-col-mbp
_3-col-tablet
_4-columns-tablet
gap-row-32px
gap-row-48px
gap-row-32px
gap-row-80px
gap-44px
Breakpoint Behavior:
Desktop (1024px+)
Full grid layouts with all columns visible
Tablet (768px - 1023px)
Reduced columns: 4-col becomes 2-col, 3-col becomes 2-col, 2-col becomes 1-col
Mobile (0px - 767px)
Single column stacking with preserved gaps

Best Practices

Guidelines for effective layout implementation

Layout Selection:
Use grid-1-column for content lists and forms
Use grid-2-columns for content + sidebar layouts
Use grid-3-columns for feature showcases
Use grid-4-columns for cards and pricing tables
Responsive Design:
Always include tablet and mobile modifiers
Use appropriate gap sizes for content density
Test layouts on all breakpoints
Use container classes for consistent max-widths
Responsive Design System - Complete breakpoint & device guide

Responsive Design System

Mobile-first responsive classes and breakpoints

Interactive responsive examples with live previews

Copy-paste responsive CSS classes and media queries

Responsive Breakpoints

Purpose: Mobile-first responsive design system with five key breakpoints for optimal user experience across all devices. Uses CSS media queries and utility classes for precise control.

Desktop Breakpoints

Extra Large (1920px+)

@media screen and (min-width: 1920px)

Large Desktop (1440px+)

@media screen and (min-width: 1440px)

Desktop (1280px+)

@media screen and (min-width: 1280px)

Mobile & Tablet Breakpoints

Tablet (768px - 991px)

@media screen and (max-width: 991px)

Mobile Large (480px - 767px)

@media screen and (max-width: 767px)

Mobile Small (0px - 479px)

@media screen and (max-width: 479px)

Responsive Utility Classes

Pre-built utility classes for common responsive patterns. These classes automatically adjust spacing, layout, and visibility based on screen size.

Spacing Classes

.mg-bottom-48px.mg-bottom-48px-tablet
Desktop: 80px bottom margin → Tablet: 48px bottom margin
.mg-bottom-8px-mob
Mobile: 8px bottom margin for compact spacing
.mg-bottom-48px
Standard 48px bottom margin for all breakpoints

Layout Classes

.grid-2-columns._1-col-tablet
Desktop: 2 columns → Tablet: 1 column stacked
.show-in-tablet
Show element only on tablet and smaller screens
.mobile_menu
Mobile navigation menu container

Responsive Best Practices

Guidelines for implementing responsive design that ensures optimal user experience across all devices.

Mobile-First Approach

Design for mobile screens first, then enhance for larger screens
Use min-width media queries for progressive enhancement
Touch-friendly interface with minimum 44px tap targets
Optimize images and reduce unnecessary animations on mobile

Performance Optimization

Use CSS Grid and Flexbox for efficient layouts
Implement lazy loading for images and heavy content
Minimize HTTP requests with CSS sprites and bundling
Use responsive images with srcset and sizes attributes

Content Strategy

Prioritize essential content for smaller screens
Use progressive disclosure for complex interfaces
Implement collapsible sections and accordions
Ensure readable typography with appropriate line heights

Testing & Validation

Test on real devices, not just browser dev tools
Validate touch interactions and gesture support
Check performance on slower networks and devices
Ensure accessibility compliance across all breakpoints

Complete CSS Media Queries

Copy-paste media query structure used throughout the design system:
/* Mobile Small - 0px to 479px */
@media screen and (max-width: 479px) {
  .mg-bottom-48px { margin-bottom: 24px !important; }
  .mg-bottom-48px { margin-bottom: 24px !important; }
  .grid-2-columns { grid-template-columns: 1fr !important; }
}

/* Mobile Large - 480px to 767px */
@media screen and (max-width: 767px) {
  .mg-bottom-48px { margin-bottom: 32px !important; }
  .mg-bottom-48px { margin-bottom: 32px !important; }
  .grid-2-columns { grid-template-columns: 1fr !important; }
  .mobile_menu { display: block !important; }
}

/* Tablet - 768px to 991px */
@media screen and (max-width: 991px) {
  .mg-bottom-48px.mg-bottom-48px-tablet { margin-bottom: 48px !important; }
  ._1-col-tablet { grid-template-columns: 1fr !important; }
  .show-in-tablet { display: block !important; }
}

/* Desktop - 1280px and up */
@media screen and (min-width: 1280px) {
  .container { max-width: 1200px; }
  .grid-2-columns { grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; }
}

/* Large Desktop - 1440px and up */
@media screen and (min-width: 1440px) {
  .container { max-width: 1320px; }
  .pricing-template-body { max-width: 1200px; }
}

/* Extra Large Desktop - 1920px and up */
@media screen and (min-width: 1920px) {
  .container { max-width: 1440px; }
  .pricing-template-body { max-width: 1320px; }
}

Responsive Utilities Reference

Quick reference for all responsive utility classes available in the design system:
/* Responsive Spacing Classes */
.mg-bottom-48px.mg-bottom-48px-tablet    /* 80px → 48px on tablet */
.mg-bottom-8px-mob                       /* 8px margin on mobile only */
.mg-bottom-8px-copy                      /* Standard 8px margin */
.mg-bottom-48px                          /* Standard 48px margin */

/* Responsive Layout Classes */
.grid-2-columns._1-col-tablet            /* 2 cols → 1 col on tablet */
.gap-row-32px                            /* 32px gap between rows */
.gap-row-32px                            /* 64px gap between rows */

/* Responsive Visibility Classes */
.show-in-tablet                          /* Show on tablet and mobile */
.hide-on-mobile                          /* Hide on mobile devices */
.mobile_menu                             /* Mobile menu container */

/* Responsive Container Classes */
.container.is-mobile-menu                /* Mobile menu container */
.desktop-wrapper-section-with-images     /* Desktop section wrapper */
.pricing-template-body                   /* Responsive content body */

/* Usage Examples */
<div class="grid-2-columns _1-col-tablet gap-row-32px">
  <div class="mg-bottom-48px mg-bottom-48px-tablet">Content</div>
  <div class="show-in-tablet">Mobile/Tablet Only</div>
</div>
